description: On "The Pat McAfee Show" Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one of a kind opinions that won't be heard anywhere else. Pat's a recently retired NFL All Pro who has zero filter. A common man who has experience in an extremely uncommon professional athlete lifestyle is a beautiful concoction of hilarity for the average Joe. Both relatable and ridiculous, "The Pat McAfee Show" promises to inform, intrigue, and entertain at least twice a week. Thanks for listening. Cheers. #Viva
title: The Pat McAfee Show presented by Barstool Sports

episodes.title: PMS 215 - A Star Studded Fantasy Friday
episodes.description: On today's, Pat and the crew sit down with four different guests for a couple of incredible conversations. First, 2X Pro Bowler, 3X Super Bowl Champion, and host of The Stinkin' Truth Podcast, Mark Schlereth, joins the show. They chat about his outlook on his kids and grandkids, internet trolls coming after his bench press form, what he expects from the Denver Broncos this year, what it was like playing with and hanging out with John Elway, how he thinks given the rules, he could play in the NFL still, and he gives an incredible take on CTE from a players perspective (2:41-23:29). Next, adult film icon, SiriusXM host, and fantasy sports expert, Lisa Ann calls into the show. They discuss how she got into the adult film business, what she thinks about Jimmy G going on a date with a pornstar this offseason and what the protocol for that is, what she's doing to help younger stars in the industry, and she highlights some of her favorite fantasy sleepers for the upcoming NFL season (26:43-42:53). Later, NFL Insider, Ian Rapoport joins the show. He gives some updates on the Aaron Donald contract situation, how he cultivates sources, if he's ever been burned by a source to the point of ex-communication, what the biggest news story he's broken in his career has been, and he looks ahead to the NFL season (49:19-1:01:41). Lastly, coming off a bareknuckle boxing victory in Biloxi, Mississippi, UFC legend Chris "Lights Out" Lytle joins the show. He talks about his experience competing in a bareknuckle boxing event for the second time, how little he knew about his opponent going in, whether he thinks that promotion can compete with the UFC, his mindset while in the ring, and he looks ahead to his next bareknuckle fight (1:04:47-1:21:23). As always, Nick selects a couple of Friday Bangerz to help send you into the week in fantastic fashion. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 214 - Brian Urlacher
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Digs, Nick, Todd, and Zito has they break down everything that happened in the 4th episode of Hard Knocks including Todd Haley disrespecting The Brand, whether or not Tyrod Taylor is feeling the heat with Baker Mayfield at his heels, Myles Garrett loving jazz music and dismantling offenses, and Mychal Hendricks going after his former teammates (and subsequently being indicted on insider trading), and everything else you need to know about the Cleveland Browns. Also joining the show is 8X Pro Bowler, 4X 1st Team All-Pro, former Defensive Player of the Year and Defensive Rookie of the Year, and newly minted Hall of Famer, Brian Urlacher. They chat about his Hall of Fame experience and why he was nervous leading up to it, some of his craziest locker room gambling stories, what he thinks of the Bears as they seek to discover a new identity, what he's been up to since he retired, and who he thinks is going to be the best team in the NFL this year, and who is going to underperform in an absolutely hilarious interview (30:13-50:11). Later, sports marketing agent Darren Prince, whose clients have included Magic Johnson, Muhammed Ali, Joe Frazier, Dennis Rodman, and many more, joins the show to promote his new book, "Aiming High." He chats about how he was instrumental in setting up Dennis Rodman's trip to North Korea to meet Kim Jong Un, how he got started in the sports marketing business, his struggles with alcohol and opioid addiction and what he's doing to combat it now, and what he thinks the defining moment in his career thus far (53:39-1:09:04). After the show, stick around for a throwback Thursday comedy clip of Pat retelling the infamous Peyton Manning "bet on Red 18," story. It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 213 - Le'Veon Bell
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito as they recap what happened over the weekend, including Pat wondering if the Patriots might be in trouble this year after a couple of lackluster showings into the preseason, and Tom Brady's recent drama with ending an interview with WEEI's Kirk & Callahan after being asked questions about his fitness guru, Alex Guerrero. Pat also recounts his hilarious time at a Pentecostal church over the weekend and witnessing the pastor delivering the Holy Spirit to people first hand. Also joining the show is the CEO of The Sports Entertainment group and the agent of Le'Veon Bell, Adisa Bakari. They chat about working to get Le'Veon a new deal during the offseason, how exactly the franchise tag works in this particular situation and what will happen if the Steelers try to franchise him again, if time off during the preseason has hurt his market value, what he thinks about Le'Veon's rap career, and he talks a couple of the potential teams interested in Le'Veon if they are unable to work out a deal with the Steelers (23:19-40:53). Later, IndyCar and now NASCAR driver and friend of the show, Conor Daly, calls in to talk about his crazy weekend involving being dropped by his chief sponsor, Lilly Diabetes, what it was like getting behind the wheel in a NASCAR and how it differs from driving an IndyCar, and what his plans for the future are with this season coming to a close (43:32-53:50). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 212 - Kyle Rudolph & Bruce Arians
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is out of town on another top secret business meeting, but we've still got two incredible interviews to cap off the week. First, 2X Pro Bowler and one of the best TE's in the NFL, Kyle Rudolph, joins the show. They discuss how the Vikings have looked so far in the preseason with Kirk Cousins at the helm, what it's been like adjusting to new offensive coordinator John DeFilippo's system, whether or not Mike Zimmer is really as hard-nosed as he seems, how he thinks Teddy Bridgewater is going to fair with the New York Jets, and if Notre Dame football is ever going to be any good again (8:56-21:43). Next, former Head Coach of the Arizona Cardinals and interim Head Coach for the Indianapolis Colts and current broadcaster for CBS, Bruce Arians, joins the show for another electric conversation. They chat about how he's adapted to not coaching football and what CBS has been doing to prepare him for his first gig when the Browns and Steelers square off week 1, whether or not he's going to have trouble not going after refs, how much he thinks the new rules are going to impact the game, and who the best athlete he's ever coached is (25:19-38:10). To close out the show, the guys each pick a Friday Banger to help send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 211 - Aaron Rodgers
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat finally lands his white whale as 6X Pro Bowler, 2X NFL MVP, and Super Bowl XLV Champion, Aaron Rodgers joins the show for an incredible conversation. They chat about his expectations for the coming season, whether or not coming back from injury makes him appreciate the game more, his thoughts on the new helmet rules and how it affects play, what he likes to do to have fun, and how he expects his contract negotiations to play out (44:20-1:01:24). The guys also do another deep dive on this week's Hard Knocks episode including everything they loved about it, and the emergence of possibly the greatest character in Hard Knocks history, O-Line coach Bob Wylie. Also joining the show is VP of Production for HBO Sports and Senior Producer on Hard Knocks, Dave Harmon. He gives everyone a look behind the curtain of Hard Knocks and discusses what goes into making the show, whether or not the producers make any suggestions for content, if the Browns have final cut and get to choose what gets omitted from the episode, and he gives his opinion on who the best character on Hard Knocks has been (20:00-39:12). Today's a great one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 210 - The World's Strongest Hero
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Todd, Digs, Nick, and Zito as they cover everything that happened over the weekend including Pat's crazy couple of days in Brooklyn for NXT Takeover and a hilarious story about The World's Strongest Man, Mark Henry, having to carry him home from Times Square. They also cover Josh Gordon returning to the Browns and what his absence could have possibly been, and they dive deeper into the new helmet rule and how it may be ruining the NFL. WWE Superstar Bobby Lashley also joins the show for an incredible conversation. They chat about his road to the WWE, how being the victim of a botched bank robbery ended his Olympic wrestling career and started his sports entertainment career, how he keeps his body looking the way it does, and Pat gives him a few pointers on how to grow his social media brand (41:42-1:06:57). Later, current Smackdown Women's Champion and one of the biggest stars in the WWE, Charlotte Flair, joins the show. They chat about what it's been like establishing herself in her father's shadow, how trying to save her brother's life got her into the wrestling business, and what its been like being at the forefront of the women's evolution movement in the WWE (1:07:31-1:15:09). It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 209 - Another Beautiful Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Digs, Todd, Nick, and Zito discuss Lavar Ball's recent comments about Lonzo and LeBron coexisting together in Los Angeles, they cover Hue Jackson's recent comments that Drew Stanton will be the backup quarterback ahead of Baker Mayfield and whether or not that's a good decision, Pat explains how he's started to love cooking and how that differs from where he used to be as well as wondering how he can be on a meat exclusive keto diet and lose the same amount of as a vegan. Pat also breaks down the current animal situation in his house, they battle some adversity as more construction goes on directly behind the studio, and Pat breaks down one of his favorite shows on TV, America's Got Talent. Later, cohost of the Around The NFL podcast, NFL Network analyst Chris Wesseling joins the show. They discuss his recent article about Jon Gruden and Martavis Bryant's relationship and whether or not the Raiders are going to be any good, who some of his picks for surprise team in the NFL this year is, his thoughts on this season of Hard Knocks so far, and he breaks down his path to writing for the NFL and chats about recently becoming cancer free (38:20-50:01). As always, Nick selects a couple of  Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 208 - "I Smell Weed In The Car"
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Digs, Nick, Todd, and Zito cover everything going on in the NFL including Pat doing a complete 180 on his thoughts about the Browns after watching the 2nd episode of Hard Knocks. The guys are also joined by a trio of incredible guests to talk all things NFL. First, Mike Florio of Pro Football Talk joins the show to talk about his article on how the Browns are dealing with Antonio Callaway getting pulled over with a suspended license and weed in his car, and his thoughts on Jalen Ramsey taking shots at almost every quarterback in the NFL (33:08-48:06). Next, Super Bowl Champion, 2x Pro Bowler, and one of the best kickers in the league, Justin Tucker of the Baltimore Ravens joins the show. They chat about how his training camp has been so far, how singing opera and football are similar, whether or not he's superstitious before kicks, what he thinks of some of the rule changes and how they'll affect kickers, and what he thinks of fantasy football (50:28-1:08:50). Lastly, former offensive lineman and 2nd round pick of the Indianapolis Colts, Jack Mewhort, calls in to discuss what he's been doing since he retired, how one of his mistakes started one of the greatest field goal streaks in NFL history, whether or not he's worried about CTE down the road, and what he's going to miss most about playing football (1:12:46-1:21:18). It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 207 - Live From Colts Training Camp
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Todd, Nick, Digs, and Zito are live from training camp with the Indianapolis Colts with a couple of incredible football conversations. Joining the show first is Colts GM Chris Ballard, new Head Coach Frank Reich, and 4x Pro Bowl WR T.Y. Hilton to discuss everything that has been going on so far in training camp, what the Colts plan on doing with all of their cap space, who some of the standout rookies have been so far in camp, how Ballard and Reich have tried to create a new culture and identity in Indianapolis, whether or not they like Andrew Luck's mustache, and more (2:25-21:52). Later, 4x Super Bowl Champ, the greatest kicker who has ever lived, Adam Vinatieri, joins the guys on set. They discuss whether or not he ever gets nervous anymore, how camp changes from year to year, what it's like having his son out on the field being a ball boy, he chats about one of his passion projects, Record Breaking Ranch, his new all-inclusive hunting cabin in Missouri, what he plans on doing once he's retired, and which team he will decide to be inducted into Canton with (25:58-54:13). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 206 - Canada Invades Friday Bangerz
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Todd, Zito, and everyone's favorite Canadian, Gump, is with the fellas in studio. They cover how Gumpy went from caller on The Pat McAfee Show to being pals with everyone at the Heartland, how his travel into Indianapolis was, and the guys talk a little preseason football. Also joining the show is former Colts, Cardinals, and Ravens cornerback Jerraud Powers to chat about what he's been doing in his time off from football, he recalls Pat getting ready to play quarterback in an actual NFL game, he gives his opinion about the new NFL rules and whether he likes them or not, and questions whether Pat is achieving his Caucasian Rock look naturally (4:42-22:52). Later, NFL reporter Steve Wyche joins the show to discuss everything going on around the NFL. They cover Andrew Luck's comeback, the Leveon Bell/Steelers situation, who some of his teams to look out for are this upcoming season, what he thinks about the Browns and Hard Knocks, and why no one ever talks about the Saints (28:01-45:11). To close out the show, Gump helps Nick select a couple of Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 205 - Action Packed Nude Dude Brawl
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito as Pat breaks down everything there is to know about the Browns and what he thinks of them after watching the first episode of HBO's Hard Knocks. He dives into what he thinks about Hue Jackson, Todd Haley, Jarvis Landry, Baker Mayfield, and gives his thoughts on what the Browns will be doing this upcoming season. Also joining the show is former Iowa Hawkeye legend and middle linebacker for the Indianapolis Colts, Pat Angerer, for an incredible conversation. They chat about what he's been doing since he retired from the NFL, his concussion and injury issues and what he thinks of the direction of the new NFL, how much he got made fun of for being a white guy, and he tells an absolutely hilarious story about a naked locker room brawl he was involved in and Pat witnessed (52:52-1:14:40). It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 204 - I Met Bill Burr
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, Zito, and Jourdyn to recap everything from Rough 'N' Rowdy 4 in Youngstown, OH including all the best moments from Bill Burr to the fights themselves and a recap of Pat's electric night on the microphone. Pat also does a deep dive into the newest Avengers movie and tries to make sense of it all after watching it over the weekend, and the guys chat about Last Chance U, and how it shares some parallels with Pat's West Virginia experience, and how it shines a light on some of the issues with the NCAA. Also joining the show is former Patriots 2nd round pick and Colts cornerback/safety, one of the smoothest athletes alive, Darius Butler for a great conversation. They cover what he's been up to while being a free agent, he educates the people about what his job was on the football field, how he feels about all the helmet/concussion issues and new rules, and whether or not he's considered joining one of the many new professional basketball leagues (47:26-58:45). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 203 - An Incredible Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Digs, Todd, Nick, and Zito as they share their favorite news stories of the week including Tiger vs. Phil over Thanksgiving weekend in Vegas, the NFL returning with the Hall of Fame game, how getting cheated on can actually be beneficial financially, and Matt Damon and Ben Affleck making a movie about the McDonald's Monopoly scandal. Stopping by in studio is Bellator Heavyweight Grand Prix favorite Matt Mitrione and former UFC legend and current bareknuckle boxing championship contender, Chris Lytle for an incredible chat with the guys. They cover Mitrione's recent bender in Vegas, what he and Lytle have been doing training wise for their respective fights, what the difference between an NFL training camp and a fight camp is, and each guy gives an insight into their upcoming fights (19:48-43:30). As always, Nick selects some Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. After the show, stick around for a couple of interviews with two of the marquee fighters featured on this weekend's Rough 'N' Rowdy card. First, Barstool blogger Pat McAuliffe joins the show to talk about his matchup in the main event on the card, a little bit about his training regimen leading up to the fight, and what he did prior to joining Barstool. Next, former Youngstown police officer, Ryan Young, joins the show to discuss his situation and the scandal he's been involved in leading up to the fight, what his prediction for the fight is, and what he plans on doing after Rough 'N' Rowdy (1:01:51-1:32:15). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 202 - Richie Incognito
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Todd, Digs, Nick, and Zito as they turn their attention towards the start of the NFL season in an episode heavy on NFL talk. First, former scout for the Eagles, Ravens, and Browns, analyst for NFL Network, and current LA Chargers color analyst, Daniel Jeremiah joins the show. They cover everything going on at training camp and some of the players he's most excited keeping an eye on, what he expects from this NFL season, and who his contenders in the AFC and NFC are in an interview that covers everything you need to know about the coming NFL season (8:30-24:40). Next, 4x Pro Bowler and former offensive lineman for the St. Louis Rams, Miami Dolphins, and Buffalo Bills, Richie Incognito joins the show in an absolutely wild interview. They chat about his recent run in with police that was all over TMZ, whether or not he really plans on pursuing a career in politics, he does a deep dive and gives his side of the Jonathan Martin situation and how it affected everything, and he explains what he's been up to these days (38:06-1:00:31). It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 201 - It's Great To Be Back BAY BAY
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is back from vacation in the Bahamas and is joined by Todd, Nick, Zito, and Jourdyn to chat about what they did with their time off. They also cover the McDonald's Monopoly scandal, Alex Trebek's upcoming retirement from Jeopardy! and Pat recommends a couple of documentaries that he watched while on vacation. Also joining the show in studio is Colts linebacker Najee Goode on his day off to discuss how the things have been going from Colts training camp, whether or not Andrew Luck is really back, and who some of the standouts have been so far (49:52-1:07:21). Come laugh with us, Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 200 - Pat's NFL Draft Story, Pardon My Take, And Adam Vinatieri
episodes.description: On today's show, Nick fills in for Pat and selects some of his favorite stories and interviews from the first 199 episodes of the Pat McAfee Show. He selects a couple of classic stories including Pat's hilarious NFL Draft Day story that inevitably changed everything (2:21-10:19), and one of the original Behind The Badge stories where Todd tells the now infamous chicken story (29:10-37:23). Also included is an interview with Big Cat and PFT Commenter of Pardon My Take where Pat and Big Cat's relationship is explained a little more and how Pat details how he eventually found himself working for Barstool (13:03-26:00). Nick's final selection is the incredible interview Pat did with the most clutch athlete of all time, the GOAT, Adam Vinatieri, in their first extended conversation since Pat's retirement. They cover what it was like being teammates, how Vinny reacted to Pat retiring, and Pat tells his favorite Adam Vinatieri story of all-time detailing his kicking battle with Matt Stover while Vinny was injured (41:17-1:16:48). As always, Nick picks a couple of Bangerz to help send you into the weekend the right way. Come and laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 199 - Seth Rogen, Bert Kreischer, And The Birth Of The Jim Kong Update
episodes.description: On today's show, Zito fills in to choose his favorite moments from the Pat McAfee Show while Pat is on vacation. He selects a couple of his favorite segments including the episode that birthed the Kim Jong Update and broke down Pat's interview style with guests, Pat's incredible rant about Simpson's creator Matt Groening being a time traveler, and the infamous Chuck Pagano press conference from episode 60. Zito also chooses two of his favorite interviews to close out the show. First is Pat's hilarious conversation with arguably the funniest man in Hollywood, Seth Rogen. They chat about his creative process, his favorite ways to smoke, and how he got to the position he's in right now (25:21-37:54). Last is the incredible conversation with comedy legend, "The Machine," Bert Kreischer. They cover his insane life, starting with being the genesis for the film, "Van Wilder," his story about becoming "The Machine," in Russia, his relationship with Will Smith, and his wild night out with Tracy Morgan (39:52-1:04:25). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 198 - Dave Portnoy, Bruce Arians, And Chase Rice
episodes.description: Pat's on vacation this week, so on today's show, Todd fills in and selects his favorite moments and interviews from the first 197 episodes of The Pat McAfee Show. Todd's first pick is an interview with Barstool Sports founder, Dave Portnoy. Pat and the guys sit down with Dave and discuss how he created Barstool Sports brick by brick and how it has started to evolve over the last 10+ years. They also chat about Dave's love for horses, what it's like owning a racehorse, his gambling habits, and some of the controversies he's be in over the years (4:07-34:35). Todd's next pick is Pat's hysterical interview with one of his old coaches and former head coach of the Arizona Cardinals, Bruce Arians. They cover what it takes to be a great NFL quarterback, Bruce's philosophy towards refs, what it was like coaching Andrew Luck during his rookie year, and he shares some other hilarious stories (37:34-55:05). Todd's final pick is the incredible in-studio conversation with country superstar, Chase Rice. Pat and the guys go inside his creative process as Chase samples a demo off his upcoming album, they chat about what he does when he's not touring, how he got to this point in his country music career, and what he's got coming up in the future (58:56-1:22:28). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 197 - A Super Bowl Champ, A Green Beret, And Bangerz
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat breaks the silence a little bit about his secret business trip yesterday and chats about Nick and Todd's trip down to Nashville to meet Mason Ramsey and his team. Also joining the show is former defensive end/outside linebacker and 2x Super Bowl Champion with the Patriots, Rob Ninkovich for a hilarious conversation. They discuss what he's been doing since he's retired, what the locker room was like in New England, and how his golf game is currently (14:41-34:45). Later, former Green Beret and long snapper for the Seattle Seahawks, Nate Boyer, joins the show. They chat about Pat's world record that Nate long snapped for, his foundation with Jay Glazer and what he's doing to help veterans and retired athletes, and his plan to climb Mount Kilimanjaro for 4th time (42:22-1:01:11). Pat also goes back into his playlist to choose a couple of Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 196 - LOADED THURSDAY
episodes.description: Today's show is a loaded one featuring Pat, Nick, Todd, Digs, and Zito sitting down for three hilarious conversations. First, 5x Pro Bowler, 2x First-team All-Pro, 3x receptions leader and current assistant coach for the Houston Texans, Wes Welker, joins the show. They talk about the differences between Manning and Brady, what his coaching style is like, Wes recounts his incredible Kentucky Derby experience, and Pat explains the heat he would take on the sidelines after missing a tackle on a white returner (2:10-15:44). Next, former Ravens Pro Bowl RB and friend of the show, Justin Forsett calls in. They chat about his upcoming championship game in the AFFL finals and whether he thinks the amateur team has a chance, more about his experience going on Shark Tank with the Shower Pill, and Pat tries to convince him to record an album (22:54-33:13). To close out the show, 2x Super Bowl champion and former offensive tackle for the Steelers, Max Starks, calls in for an incredible convo. They discuss what he's been doing since he retired, the Le'Veon Bell situation, Big Ben being unhappy about his replacement being drafted, if he really had to borrow a pair of Shaq's shoes when he was in grade school in Orlando, and whether or not he's thought about slimming down since retirement (36:11-58:27). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 195 - Marshawn Lynch Was A Hero In The Story
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Digs, Nick, Todd, and Zito chat about the Le'Veon Bell situation with the Steelers and what some of their options are going forward. They also discuss Pat being courted for the next season of The Amazing Race, Todd going down to Nashville to meet Mason Ramsey and his grandma and grandpa on Thursday at his exclusive crawfish boil, Pussy Riot protesting under Putin's nose in the World Cup final, who took the biggest hits in the twitter follower purge, and the guys do a deeper dive into Pat's Italian heritage. Also joining the show is 9-year NFL veteran and former Bills and Seahawks running back, Fred Jackson. They chat about his experiences thus far in the AFFL, what he's doing now that he's retired from the NFL, whether or not he enjoyed playing in the cold weather in Buffalo, what he really thought about Bills Mafia, and the time TMZ reported that he and Marshawn Lynch got into a car accident while street racing (54:37-1:07:46). It's a good time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 194 - Netflix Legend David S. Rudolf
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito are joined by a couple of incredible guests. First, the undisputed star of the Netflix original series, "The Staircase," Criminal Defense and Civil Rights Attorney, David S. Rudolf joins the show for an unbelievable conversation. They cover all the little details that made "The Staircase" as compelling as it was, whether or not David was apprehensive to have it all filmed, his thoughts on the Owl Theory, and Pat picks his brain some more about some of the more interesting aspects of the Michael Peterson case (7:17-31:41). Later, 11-year veteran and former quarterback for the Seattle Seahawks, Cleveland Browns, and the Green Bay Packers, Seneca Wallace joins the show. They chat about him tearing up the AFFL and look ahead to the championship game this weekend, who some of his favorite current quarterbacks to watch are, what he picked up playing with Aaron Rodgers, and what it's like owning a Wingstop (44:33-1:02:40). As always, the guys pick a couple of Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. It's a great one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 193 - A Super Bowl Champion Joins Us
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Todd, Digs, Nick, and Zito discuss England coming home... without the World Cup and look ahead to the France and Croatia final, relive Zito losing in a 40 yesterday, chat about the return of the mafia, and break down Trump cutting WWE promos at the NATO summit. Also joining the show in studio is Pat's former West Virginia teammate, and current linebacker for the Indianapolis Colts, Najee Goode. They chat about him winning a Super Bowl, what he thought of the "Philly Philly" play, what the parade was like and whether Jason Kelce is still alive, the general feeling around the Colts building leading up to training camp, and what Najee plans to do after football as he is the co-owner of a burgeoning technology company (13:12-37:14). Also joining the show is Pro Bowler and first team All-Pro, current linebacker for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, Lavonte David. The guys chat about what he thought about Jameis Winston's eating W's speech, what he expects the Bucs to do this year, what some of his favorite movies are, and what the Bucs do to stay competitive with each other in the locker room (51:36-1:06:00). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 192 - "Lights Out" With Shawne Merriman
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Todd, Digs, Nick, and Zito as they discuss Tiger and Phil Mickelson's potential $10 million match play event, and give their suggestions on how to make it the most successful, recap everyone's week off including the guys heading back to Pittsburgh to play in the Plum hockey golf outing, Brock Lesnar returning to the UFC and immediately cutting a world class WWE promo. Pat also previews a couple of the guests that he's been trying to line up for upcoming shows, and the guys look ahead to the semifinals of the World Cup. Also joining the show is Chargers legend, former Defensive Rookie of the Year, 2x First-team All-Pro, and 3x Pro Bowler, Shawne "Lights Out" Merriman for an incredible conversation about what he's been up to since retiring, how his Lights Out Clothing Brand is doing, his involvement in the MMA world, his acting career, what he thinks of the current state of the NFL, and what player he hit the hardest in his career (18:21-34:29). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 191 - Flashback Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat recaps his 4th of July, chats about Darren Lovell's hot dog Twitter beef after the Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest, what some of the documentaries he's watched during his week off were, and breaks down what he thinks about people on Instagram and Facebook referring to themselves as public figures. Also included is a best of collection of interviews from the early days of the Pat McAfee show with guests including social media guru Gary Vaynerchuk (22:51-39:40), Pat's first conversation with PGA legend and good friend of the show, John Daly (39:41-54:37), and a hilarious conversation with future NFL Hall of Famer and one of the greatest RB's to ever live, Edgerrin James (54:38-1:12:35). It's a good one. Start your weekend off the right way. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 190 - An American Celebration
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat and Digs break down LeBron heading to LA and signing with the Lakers, chat about another crazy weekend of World Cup action, and react to some incredibly patriotic quotes to help you launch into the 4th of July the right way. Also included on today's show is an interview from a very early episode of The Pat McAfee Show. Pat, Todd, Nick, and Digs traveled to New York to interview Barstool personality, marine, and co-host of the Zero Blog Thirty podcast, Uncle Chaps. The guys recount how Chaps received his Purple Heart as he relives the night he got shot, and he also pays tribute to some of his other brothers-in-arms in an incredibly emotional and powerful conversation (33:35-55:57). Come laugh with us, and enjoy your 4th of July celebrating the greatness of our country. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 189 - Bangerz On Top Of Bangerz On Top of Bangerz
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Digs, Nick, Todd, and Zito as they recap their favorite news stories of the week including Russian Burger King World Cup promotions, the blood moon to end the world, relief pitchers shitting their pants before having to pitch, and surviving the Permit Patty fallout, and check in on the state of the Oakland Raiders with Coach Gruden. Also joining the show is SI columnist, Greg Bishop, to discuss his incredibly powerful article on Washington State quarterback Tyler Hilinski's family coming to terms with his untimely death, what he did to put the piece together, how tough it was putting pen to paper, whether or not he'd let his son play football after all his research, and what the Hilinski family is doing in response to the situation (24:45-43:15). To wrap up the show, Pat has the aux cord for this edition of Friday Bangerz, and gives a nice little insight to what his everyday playlist includes. Let us help you start the weekend the right way. Come laugh with us, Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 188 - Incredible Conversations
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito are joined by a couple of great guests for two incredible conversations. First, 11-year NFL veteran for the New England Patriots, 3 time Super Bowl Champion, 3 time Pro Bowler, former All-Pro, and member of the Patriots 50th anniversary team, former offensive tackle Matt Light joins the show from The Maid of the Mist to chat about his new vodka company, what it was like playing for the Patriots his entire career, who some of his toughest defensive assignments were, and what he thinks about the current state of the NFL (3:53-21:45). Also joining the show is 10 year NHL veteran and former All-Star game MVP, John Scott for one of the most hilarious conversations the guys have had. He chats about his disdain for Gary Bettman, what it was like being an enforcer in the NHL and why the position is vanishing, how he used to approach fights in games, what some of his future plans are including a book and new movie, and who he thinks the greatest NHL player of all-time is (28:39-45:08). The guys also discuss whether or not Kris Jenner could win the presidency, pay tribute to Bruce/Caitlyn Jenner as one of the greatest athletes of all-time, Pat learns that Alex Jones is not a comedian, and Zito takes another crack at an ad read. It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 187 - A Conversation With Terry Crews
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Digs, Todd, Nick, Zito, and Jourdyn discuss everything that happened over the weekend. Pat also gives a public service announcement to Permit Patty and places her in a different class of caucasian people. They also discuss the insanity of the Mary Kay Letourneau story, chat a bit about what Slenderman is, and cover all the craziness of the World Cup including Germany's walk off, the budding super stardom of Icelandic midfielder Rúrik Gíslason, and how their bets have been faring. Also joining the show is Hollywood superstar and former NFL player Terry Crews, for an incredible conversation about how he stays in impeccable shape at 49, what some of his favorite films he's worked on are, what it was like being the Old Spice spokesman, and previews his new film "Sorry to Bother You" (2:16-16:36). Later, former captain of the 2000 Men's Olympic soccer team, MLS legend, and co-host of Counterattack on Sirius XM, Brian "Dunny" Dunseth joins the show to talk all things World Cup, what he thinks the problem with US men's soccer is, who he believes will be the next national team coach, and whether or not he thinks the MLS will ever achiever the same status as soccer overseas (26:36-41:22). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 186 - Professional Baseball Debut And Dak Prescott
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito break down everything about Pat's professional baseball debut with the Washington Wildthings including his Hall of Fame worthy on base percentage, an in depth breakdown of his at bats, and what some of his favorite moments of the night were. Also joining the show is current starting quarterback for the Dallas Cowboys, Dak Prescott, for an incredible conversation covering his expectations for this NFL season, what he and some of his teammates do to build chemistry, who some of his new weapons will be with the departure of Jason Witten and Dez Bryant, and his Ready, Raise, Rise campaign (40:14-52:26). As always, the guys select a few Friday Bangerz to help start your weekend the right way. Come laugh with us. Cheers

episodes.title: PMS 185 - Absolutely Loaded Show
episodes.description: Today's show is a great one. Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito as they discuss his professional baseball debut, what he's been doing to prepare, and what some of his plans are for the game. Also joining the show are three incredible guests. First, Host of Dialed-In on Barstool Power 85, co-host of Starting 9, and former Oakland A's pitching great, Dallas Braden, joins the show to give Pat a couple of pointers on what to expect, whether he thinks Pat can get a hit, he walks the guys through his perfect game, and breaks down his relationship with A-Rod (12:47-38:06). Next, NBA Insider and co-host of The Jump and SportsNation, Amin Elhassan, joins the show to discuss the NBA draft, free agency, whether or not Jay-Z joining Puma matters, and where he expects guys like LeBron and Kawhi Leonard to end up (43:43-1:00:20). Lastly, memorabilia and collectible guru Brandon Steiner joins the show to chat about what some of his highest selling items are, what some of the hottest pieces of memorabilia are, how his company achieves authenticity, and where he sees the business going in the future (1:01:05-1:23:21). It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 184 - An Incredible Weekend Recap
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Todd, Digs, Nick, Zito, and Jourdyn recap the weekend including Pat's wild weekend co-hosting the NXT Takeover preshow, the wild weekend at the US Open and what everyone thought about it including Phil Mickelson “offending” the entire golf world, and the guys ride the rails for a couple of World Cup games hoping their bets pay off as they are joined by a couple of soccer correspondents from the radio show. Also joining the show is Barstool's own wrestling aficionado, Robbie Fox, to discuss what he thought of the NXT Takeover and Money In The Bank pay-per-views, how he thought Pat did on the preshow, and what the general consensus from wrestling fans was (17:27-28:18). Later, Pat's co-host from the NXT Takeover event, the last professional broadcaster, Sam Roberts, joins the show to give his thoughts on how he thought the preshow went, what some of his favorite moments were, and what he expects from Pat's future with the WWE (35:00-43:45). It's a fun one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 183 - Fantastic Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Todd, Digs, Nick, and Zito discuss their favorite news stories of the week including people getting their heads stuck in tailpipes, an African man being buried in a brand new BMW, some World Cup tidbits, Nick explains what's wrong with the internet in a rant for the ages, and Pat shares some of his unreleased interview with the NFL network post surgery. Everyone's favorite major champion, John Daly, joins the show to break down what to expect from this years US Open, who some of his favorites and dark horses are, whether or not he and Pat will continue their pro-am undefeated streak at The Greenbrier, and what he has been up to as of late (00:26-12:23). Also joining the show is the Last American Broadcaster, Sam Roberts, to chat about this weekend's NXT pre-show that he and Pat will both be on, what he is planning to wear, and whether he thinks Pat will wind up getting a shot at the North American title (01:02:16-01:12:14). As always, the guys select a few Friday Bangerz to help you kickstart the weekend. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 182 - Get Inside The Insider: Jay Glazer
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Todd, Nick, Digs, and Zito chat about the World Cup kicking off and the US getting the bid for the 2026 World Cup, what Dominos is doing that the government hasn't been able to, how steroid usage has changed in the NFL over time, and who some of the greatest college football players of all time are. NFL insider and Bellator MMA commentator Jay Glazer also joins the show to discuss how he's helping veterans and former athletes with his MVP organization, some of the celebrities that are currently working out at his gym, where he thinks Dez Bryant might wind up, and what he thinks of TO's Hall of Fame situation (5:07-25:23). Later, Cory Gregory of maxeffortmuscle.com and co-host of the Business and Biceps podcast calls in to chat about his revolutionary new pill that may sweep the nation, how they developed the pill, and how they tried advertising it with Pat (41:26-52:24). After the show, stick around for the wrestling recap as Robbie Fox joins the show to chat about this weekend's NXT and Money In The Bank event's in Chicago, how he thinks Pat will fare, and what he expects from the whole weekend (1:12:53-1:38:43). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 181 - Jake Johnson And Isaiah Pead
episodes.description: Today's show is loaded. Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Zito, and Todd as they discuss Justify winning the Triple Crown and the outrageous stud fee that his trainers demand from other suitors, and what they think that process is exactly. They also dive into the new Netflix crime documentary series The Staircase as Pat breaks it down a little bit and explains why he is so interested in it, and why everyone else should be too. Big Cat also calls into the show (with a surprise drop-in from Rico Bosco) to explain his theory that he could beat any professional athlete in at least one sport, and why he thinks so (1:03:25-1:20:13). Also included are interviews with one of the stars of the hit show “The New Girl,” and the new film, “Tag,” Jake Johnson, as he and the guys chat about what drew him to doing Tag, what it was like having his family in Atlanta when they were filming, what things were like on set, and what some of his upcoming projects are (00:25-13:32) and former Cincinnati running back and 2nd round draft pick of the St. Louis Rams, Isaiah Pead, calls into the show to chat about how his focus has shifted from football to the winning a gold medal in the Paralympics after losing part of his left leg in a terrible car accident. He chats about his new outlook on things, what he's doing to prepare for the Paralympics, and how he's enjoying life one day at a time in an incredibly uplifting and inspiring interview (30:47-48:57). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 180 - This Should Win An Award Of Some Sort
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito as they break down some of their favorite news stories of the week including IHOP changing its name to IHOB, crooked Fifa refs taking bribes before the World Cup, the absolute unit who is heading the kitchen staff at the White House, an Alabama woman's wild bank robbery attempt, and Zito breaks down his entrance into the Twitch world. Also joining the show is former Sports Illustrated columnist, author, HOF voter, and current NFL media member Jim Trotter for an incredibly insightful conversation covering some of the issues today's NFL is facing including his opinion on where the NFL goes from here with the anthem protests, his reaction and what he's hearing from the Eagles' White House invite being rescinded, why Hall of Fame voters haven't voted for more specialists, and the guys break the news that TO won't be attending his induction into Canton (12:09-32:27). As always, Nick selects a few Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 179 - Friend Of The Show, Jason
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito to discuss the guys past Father's Day experiences in Pittsburgh, pissing in pools, what sharks in Brazil have done to keep people out of the water, and the Grand Theft Auto situation out of Virginia where a soldier stationed there decided to steal a tank like vehicle, and what some of his motives may have been. Later, Pat, Jourdyn, and Zito make their way to Middletown, Indiana to visit friend of the Heartland, Jason Wheatley's (@hoosierfirebuff) house. They chat about how Jason battles his Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and what exactly it is, what some of his interests and hobbies are, how he stays so positive and upbeat despite the challenges he faces, and who some of his favorite callers from the radio show are in an incredibly inspiring and powerful interview (24:11 - 1:01:36). It's a good one. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 178 - A Conversation With TJ Lang
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Digs, Nick, Todd, Zito, and Jourdyn as they chat about Pat trying to battle through his flu game while trying to regain his voice back, they find out who the winner of the weight loss challenge is as Digs and Zito get two opportunities to weigh in, give their takes on the man who claims he time traveled from the year 6491 to now and what some of the changes he's experienced have been and whether or not he'd be able to predict the winner of the NBA Finals, and Pat talks about proper wedding speech preparation after taking a call from the number one caller in terrestrial radio, Rico Bosco (36:17-38:52). Also joining the show is 2x Pro Bowler, Super Bowl Champ, former Green Bay Packer and current Detroit Lion offensive lineman TJ Lang, to chat about his tweets about the replacement refs and what he thinks of the state of refereeing in today's sports, what the outlook is in Detroit this year with Matt Patricia as head coach, who he'd rather have under center between Aaron Rodgers and Matthew Stafford, what his favorite weather to play in is, and how he's been telling Clay Matthews he needed a net in front of the mound in his charity softball game for years (49:10-1:09:01). It's a good one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 177 - Wowwww, What A Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Todd, and Zito as they chat about Pat, Foxy, and Digs' performances in the Barstool Spelling Bee, the weight loss challenge coming down to the wire, some of the new march that is available and will be coming out in the future, and wrap up the show with some Friday Bangerz. Also included is a hilarious interviews with former “Workaholics” star and one of the stars of “I'm Dying Up Here,” Erik Griffin, joins the show to talk about his current standup tour and the debut of his new special “American Warrior,” what some of his goals are for his career at this stage, and how he feels about the Heartland crew (30:21-57:15). Later, co-host of the Jim and Sam show and WWE NXT panelist, the last professional broadcaster, Sam Roberts, joins the show to chat about Pat's involvement with the WWE, the Drake and Pusha T beef, Roseanne's racist comments, and more (1:01:51-1:23:25). Start your weekend the right way. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 176 - Live From A Holiday Inn Patio In New York City
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Todd, Digs, and Zito as they record the podcast Live from the patio of their hotel in New York City. The guys also welcome Lightswitch Lou Roberts and Matt Browner to the show as they discuss Zito getting booted off certain ad reads, what Louis thinks about Bryan Colangelo's burner accounts and what it means for the 76ers, who won the first round of the Pusha T/Drake beef, and are interrupted by several French tourists. Later, Hall of Fame WR Terrell Owens joins the show to chat about being on the cover of the newest Madden game, how he's still in great shape, which teams he would potentially consider for a comeback, and he tries to help settle the Jordan vs. LeBron debate (22:39-42:06). Today's show is a great time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 175 - From Wheeler Walker To Will Smith
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by the Heartland Radio crew as they chat about dealing with finding out that Judge Judy is heavily produced, how Pat handled being heckled during NFL games, some potential guests that might be popping up on the radio show, and whether or not Zito could frisbee a pancake over 40 yards. Wheeler Walker Jr. also joins the show for a hilarious conversation about his hatred for Yodel Boy, his upcoming tour with Kid Rock, what he's thinking about doing for his next album, and why Brad Paisley wants to break his jaw (12:51-28:05). Later, former Pittsburgh Penguin, Nashville Predator, and current Winger for the Western Conference Champion Las Vegas Golden Knights, James Neal, joins the show to chat about how Vegas has made an improbable run to the Stanley Cup Finals, how Vegas compares to some of the other cities he's played in, and whether or not playing road games in Vegas poses as big of a challenge as you would think (59:22-1:12:07). As always, the crew gives you a banger or two to start your Memorial Day Weekend the right way. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 174 - A Poolside Chat
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Todd, Digs, Nick, and Zito as they record the podcast from Pat's backyard around the pool. They chat about the different roasts that Pat and Todd have participated in, and how difficult it can be to maneuver those waters when you're roasting someone you don't know that well, Todd breaks down his dreams of one day owning a house boat, and Pat explains how taxes work for an NFL player. Also joining the show is former 1st round pick, and current Defensive Tackle for the Los Angeles Chargers, Corey Liuget, for a great conversation about what he's doing to prepare for the upcoming NFL season, how he's expanded his portfolio since becoming an NFL player, what some of his hobbies are, and how some of the new NFL rules will affect his style of play (44:46-54:15). It's a great time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 173 - Live From The Barn Of Bad Decisions
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Todd and Zito live from his barn of bad decisions as they battle the elements and a bad microphone from inside the barn. They discuss why kids have become so soft these days, and if there is anyway to fix it, chat a little about what Pat has been doing at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway so far this week getting ready for the Indy 500, cover a little NBA playoffs and chat about the Golden Knights improbable run to the Stanley Cup Finals.  They are also joined by former NFL and CFL punter, Josh Miller, as they discuss Johnny Football's prospects of becoming a CFL legend like Doug Flutie, and whether Josh is familiar with the sensation taking over the world known as K-Pop in a hilarious conversation (44:05) It's a fun one. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 172 - Zito's Mom Is A Saint
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by the Heartland Radio crew as they talk about their favorite news stories of the week. They discuss the Pope's Lamborghini, getting the wrong name of your kid tattooed on your body, Ukranian dolphins refusing to work for Russia, and winning the lottery and deciding to dump $200,000 worth of manure in your boss's yard. Also joining the show is one of the most electric running back's of all-time, former Tennessee Titan and Arizona Cardinal, CJ2K Chris Johnson joins the show to discuss what he's currently doing preparing for the upcoming NFL season, how he ended up at East Carolina, the time he almost beat a cheetah in a foot race, and what it was like getting shot on the eve of free agency and how he bounced back (54:27). As always, the guys send in a couple new Friday Bangerz to help launch you into the weekend. It's a good time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 171 - From The Front Lawn
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat and Zito record the episode live from the front yard of the McAfee estate and are joined by Pat's lady, Samantha. They chat about Pat's property and how he is beginning to become a big gardening guy, the different animals that roam the McAfee compound, Pat's early mornings while still playing with the Colts and how he tried to get them to change the pregame music for years, and Sam shares a hilarious story about her first date with Pat and how it couldn't have gone any worse. Friend of the show, 11 year NHL vet, and co-host of the Spittin' Chiclets podcast, Paul Bissonnette joins the show to give an NHL playoff update, chat about his new documentary series, "BizNasty Does BC," and explains how Venmo has been breaking his bank as of late (52:09). Also joining the show is current Bellator MMA Light Heavyweight Champion, and Heavyweight Grand Prix semifinalist, Ryan "Darth" Bader to discuss his upcoming fight with Matt Mitrione, what Bellator has been doing right, and what it's like being a human cockfighter (1:15:17). It's a good time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 170 - Protests In The City
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Todd, Zito, and Nick as they chat about the big time protest that Pat and Zito attended yesterday in downtown Indianapolis and what some of their observations were. Todd also tells a couple of stories about going after the Mexican drug cartel by going up the chain, and the process of dirtying up phones through wiretaps. The guys also do a deep dive into Indianapolis legend “Mr. Big” Jerry Hostetler and his ridiculous mansion that Pat's accountant thought he was going to buy, Pat looks back on some hilarious encounters with Chuck Pagano, and Zito attempts another ad read. It's a good time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 169 - Cool Convo With Chase Rice
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by the Heartland Radio crew and country superstar Chase Rice in studio to help send you into the weekend in a beautiful fashion. The guys discuss Chase's creative process, and he takes everyone through coming up with the concept of the song on a mountain in Italy to a debut demo he plays for the guys. They also chat about what his concert atmosphere is like, what he has planned for the summer, Pat and Chase reminisce on what it was like playing for Chuck Pagano, and Chase also gives out a couple of selections to be added onto the Friday Bangerz playlist (17:59). Today's show is a great time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 168 - Good Show, Good Show
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by the Heartland Radio guys and NASCAR driver Matt DiBenedetto as they chat about their favorite news stories of the week. They discuss cats being saved by firefighters, Pornhub getting into the sock game, admitting to a cocaine operation during a routine traffic stop, and Tiger and Lefty potentially facing off against each other (1:36). The guys are also joined by former NFL and CFL punter, and hilarious human, Josh Miller as they talk about Pat possibly joining a CFL roster to go after the record for most points scored by a punter in a CFL game, and he breaks down some basic CFL rules and regulations, and gives some advice on the best places to play in Canada (38:24). Today's show is a great time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 167 - A Dog Named Nipsy
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Zito, Todd, and Vibbs as they chat about the new addition to Pat's family over the weekend, and gives a live look at how she is acclimating to the other animals in his house, and they break down the mini marathon in Indianapolis. Pat also chooses which superhero he plans on playing at some point in the future, and brainstorms how he is going to build the character. MMA legend Chris Lytle also joins the show to defend himself against the allegations that he clogged the toilet in the Heartland office and then left without telling anyone (27:40). Later, actor, comedic legend, and star of his own self-entitled TV show on NBC, Marlon Wayans, joins the show to chat about getting back into standup comedy, how he structures his act, what the differences between acting in movies and tv shows are, and some of the things that he has planned in the future (1:11:52). Let's have a Tuesday. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 166 - Yodel Boy's Gonna Get His Heart Broke
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by the Heartland Radio crew as the guys break down their favorite news stories of the week. They chat about stalkers, superintendents taking dumps on school grounds, a Brinks truck losing hundreds of thousands of dollars on a highway in Indianapolis, and Yodel Boy taking the nation by storm. Also joining the show by phone is former Pittsburgh Penguin and Phoenix Coyote, and current cohost of the Spittin' Chiclets podcast, Paul Bissonnette, to chat with the boys about the NHL playoffs, what it was like having to fight over 20 guys in one of his first seasons, and some of the similarities between playing in the NHL and NFL (48:35). Friend of the Heartland, and IndyCar driver, Conor Daly also calls into the show to chat with the guys about what he's doing to prepare for the Indy 500, what he needs to do to win the race, and tries to defend his first pitch at the Cincinnati Reds game (1:03:13). As always, the guys pick a couple of fresh Friday Bangerz to send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 165 - A Birthday Celebration
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, Vibbs, Todd, and Zito as they help celebrate Pat's birthday with the man, the myth, the legend, recurring caller on the Pat McAfee Show on Sirius Barstool Power 85, and everyone's favorite Canadian, Gump. The guys shoot the breeze and learn a little bit more about what Gump does up in Canada, how he differs from everyone's perception of him, why he roots for the sports teams that he does, and why he hasn't made a trip to Indianapolis yet. Pat's former teammate and current center for the Arizona Cardinals, AQ Shipley, also calls into the show to wish Pat a happy birthday and chat about the Penguins/Capitals series, whether he has talked to Josh Rosen at all, and how the Arizona weather has been treating him so far in camp (25:05). Also included is some of the best moments from today's Sirius show birthday celebration (42:37), and Zito attempts to do his first ad read with mixed results. It's a fun one. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 164 - Nice Little Tuesday With AJ Hawk
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by the guys as they chat about this week's 20 Dollar Chef cookout, the Titans offensive line putting on a show with the catfish in Nashville, Todd enlisting Shaun's help in order to catch a criminal, how the world might be coming to an end due to the eruption of the super volcano, and their thoughts on the T-Mobile and Sprint merger, which sends them down the memory lane of some older cell phones. Also, former Super Bowl Champion and friend of the show, AJ Hawk, joins the guys to chat about his thoughts on the NFL draft, what he's been up to in the last couple of months, his plans for the Kentucky Derby weekend, and he and Pat's relationships with Guy Fieri (16:56). Let's have a Tuesday. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 163 - A Fantastic Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Nick, Digs, Todd, Zito, and Booze join Pat in studio to help propel you into the weekend. They cover their favorite news stories of the week, including cry closets at the University of Utah, Kanye riding a real hot streak and being incredibly woke, Nick gives everyone a Kim Jong update, and China giving all of their citizens overall ratings, and much more. Pat also tells the story of being dangerously close to be the starting Quarterback of the Colts during a week 17 game. And as always, the guys each pick a banger to send you into the weekend. Today's show is a good time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 162 - Crawl Across The World
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Digs, Nick, and Zito are joined in studio by The Big Easy, Eric Banks, a veteran of  multiple seasons of the Real World/Road Rules Challenge. He chats with the guys about what it was like filming the one of the most successful reality TV shows of all-time, how much of it is produced, who some of his favorite competitors and rivals were, and how he's transitioned into running a spring break experience for college kids. Pat also talks about his idea to do a bar crawl around in the world in 30 days and some other things he wants to do to enjoy his retirement. Later, Pat throws it over to Robbie Fox for an interview with WWE Intercontinental Champion, Seth Rollins, to discuss what he expects from his storylines the next couple months, what some of his favorite Royal Rumble moments are, and some of the WWE superstars that he enjoyed growing up and whether or not he listens to WWE entrance music (42:44). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 161 - Ryan Whitney & Spice Adams
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Nick, Digs, and Zito to chat more about Andrew Luck's recent book club Hall of Fame induction, the group's weekend in Louisville, and Pat's weekend trip to an animal shelter and his near death experience with a dog that was in solitary confinement. The guys also catch up with 11-year NHL vet, cohost of the Spittin' Chiclets podcast, and former Pittsburgh Penguin, Ryan Whitney, as they discuss the NHL playoffs, the odds of the Pens going back-t0-back-to-back, whether the Golden Knights can stay hot, and how the playoffs are different than the regular season (43:58). Also joining the show is one of the most electric humans on the internet, former defensive tackle of the Chicago Bears and San Francisco 49ers and friend of the show, Spice Adams, to chat about taking a punt to the house at the Penn State spring game, what he's got going on the next couple of months, what it was like brushing shoulders with Kevin Hart, and how his minivan is faring (1:05:17). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 160 - Happy 4-20
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat is joined by Shaun and the Heartland Radio crew as they help you send you into an incredible 4-20 weekend. They chat about their favorite news stories of the week including baboon's escaping from a zoo and setting up a potential Planet of the Apes situation, raccoon's consuming too much weed, they listen to a call a cop made to a dispatch center after eating too many edibles, and Pat gives a little PSA for those in a bad spot after consuming some. As always, the guys send you into the weekend with some more Friday Bangerz, and play another round of Payday Cuzzo Quizzo. It's a good time. Come laugh with us.

episodes.title: PMS 159 - A Super Bowl Champ And A Reality TV Star
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, Digs, and Zito sit down in studio with friend of the Heartland, IndyCar driver, and runner up in the reality show The Amazing Race, Conor Daly to chat about what he's been doing to gear up for the busiest month in racing, what it's like living with diabetes and how he handles it, if he would do the Amazing Race process over again, and Conor teases some of the big things he's going to be doing in the near future. Also joining the show, one of the most hilarious comedians on earth, Gary Owen, calls in to talk about his career in comedy, what it was like trying to break in to the business while in the Navy, why he's jealous of his son when it comes to comedy, and much more (2:40). Later, former Pittsburgh Steelers and New England Patriots punter and Super Bowl Champ, Josh Miller drops in to tell a couple of hilarious stories and chat with Pat about what it is like holding Adam Vinatieri's balls (48:00). Today's show is a good one. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 158 - A Very Vitamin Tuesday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Nick, Digs, and Zito record the show the from home as they keep an eye on the playoff basketball and hockey and see what's happening on the superstar shakeup on RAW. They chat about Pat's weekend back in Pittsburgh with the guys, the sickness and allergies that are floating around the office. Pat also chats with his former Colts teammate and current WWE superstar, Baron Corbin, while down in New Orleans for Wrestlemania. They chat about what it was like being teammates together and how they used to talk about wrestling together, what it's been like to be in the WWE, and where he sees himself in the WWE world in the future (14:06). The guys also chat about Patrick Reed wearing his green jacket from the Masters everywhere and whether they'd do the same, and discuss the best way to attack a trip to the casino. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 157 - Fun Fact Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat and Shaun are joined by the Heartland Radio crew to break down their favorite news stories of the week and shoot the breeze. They chat about Mark Zuckerberg testifying in front of Congress and how idiotic they sounded, mice allegedly eating over a ton of marijuana in Argentina, the NBA playoffs starting and whether or not the Cavs will be able to deal with the Tristan Thompson/Kardashian drama, and how the Polar Vortex may finally be gone for the year. As always, the guys add a couple songs to the Friday Bangerz playlist to help send you into the weekend. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 156 - Voice Of God
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick and Digs chat about Pat's experience flying home from Chicago earlier this week, and break down some of the things making waves in the news including Mark Zuckerberg testifying before Congress, whether or not the Penguins are going to win the Stanley Cup as the NHL playoffs begin, and Sister Jean potentially cursing the Cubs after her horrendous first pitch. Later, all the guys are joined by one of the most successful comedians in the world and the king of impressions, Frank Caliendo, as he chats about some of his upcoming tour locations and what he's doing with his current act, and of course runs through his rolodex of incredible impressions in an incredible interview (39:42-1:11:54). Also joining the guys is one of the most electrifying returners in the NFL, Cordarrelle Patterson, as he talks about what it's been like being a new dad, what he's expecting his role to be with the Patriots this season, and what it takes to be an elite returner in the NFL (1:12:26-1:23:32). After the show, stick around for the weekly wrestling recap with Rip Rogers, Nick, Vibbs, and Robbie Fox as they recap their weekend in New Orleans at Wrestlemania, and look ahead to some of the new story lines that will be dominating the next couple of months (1:37:32). It's a good time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 155 - Wrestlemania Was Wild
episodes.description: On today's show Pat is joined by everyone from the Heartland as the guys land back in Indianapolis after a wild weekend in New Orleans for Wrestlemania. Pat recaps his big weekend commentating the Preshow for NXT, some of the legends he met while down there, what he thought of Wrestlemania as a whole, and the guys relive a wild night on Bourbon Street (7:27). Later, the greatest Orator in the history of the WWE, and perhaps on the face of the earth, Paul Heyman, joins the show to talk about his start in the business, who some of his favorite current wrestlers are, what it's like interacting with Brock Lesnar, and he takes a couple of shots at Robbie Fox (57:41). It's been a wild couple of days. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 154 - LIVE From New Orleans
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Nick, and Vibbs are joined by Robbie Fox as the guys record live from New Orleans in preparation for the NXT Preshow and Wrestlemania. The guys discuss Vibbs being put through a table by Nick, Pat's busy day rubbing elbows with WWE superstars, and how he handled calling in to the Sirius show from two separate airports today. The guys are also joined by Irish comedian and impressionist Al Foran as he breaks down Conor McGregor going scorched earth at the UFC media today, chats about his career in comedy and what some of his goals and aspirations are, and he does some of his best impressions for the guys in one of the most electric and hilarious interviews to date (50:30). It's a great time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 153 - A Friday Like Thursday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, and Shaun are joined by the rest of the Heartland Radio guys before Pat leaves for New Orleans for his hosting gig live on Saturday night at the NXT Live Preshow before Wrestlemania. The guys discuss their favorite news stories of the week including kids pulling condoms through their noses and out of their mouths, Tim McAfee aka Block Dad's continued fame and Pat's appearance on Headline News to discuss the video, how excited everyone is for the Masters and whether Tiger can win another green jacket, and much more. After the show, stick around for this week's wrestling recap with Rip Rogers, Nick, Vibbs, and Robbie Fox live in studio to discuss everything you need to know about Wrestlemania and what they're looking forward to most about the weekend in New Orleans (1:03:26). It's a good time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 152 - McAfeeBlockParty.com
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick and Digs discuss the launch of Pat's new company, mcafeeblockparty.com, on the back of Tim McAfee going viral for pulling off the greatest Jenga move of all-time on Easter Sunday. The guys also discuss Pat watching Jesus Christ Superstar, as  he tries to piece together the story, whether or not hitmen would've used social media, and cover some other stories making waves in the news. Pat, Vibbs, and Nick also take a trip to Rip Rogers' wrestling school to get a better understanding of all the wrestling terminology ahead of Wrestlemania in New Orleans (37:07). Later, the guys are joined by Tom Segura in an absolutely hilarious interview about Pat's first time on his podcast, his new Netflix special, some of his favorite jokes to tell on stage, and what it's like being surrounded by and working with so many incredible comedians (1:12:38). It's a good time, come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 151 - Big Baseball Fans
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat and Shaun are joined by the Heartland Radio crew as they leave the studio and record from the bar in the Heartland office so they can watch MLB Opening Day as Pat and the guys dive headfirst into betting MLB games. They also discuss the age old question: Whether or not a hamburger is a sandwich, and if an ice cream sandwich is technically a cookie. Pat also chats with the guys about some of his most recent dreams, and they come to the conclusion that his dreams are shaping up like an HBO crime series, and that his most recent dream was the first episode. To close out the show, the guys give you a couple more Friday Bangerz to add to your playlist heading into the weekend. Today is a good time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 150 - A Random Thursday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, and Digs chat about Pat trying to trim a few pounds in preparation for his hosting role at NXT Live at Wrestlemania, and make phone calls to AQ Shipley to get some insight on what Pat can eat on a no carb diet (15:07) and Big Cat on the Evening Yak to get a better idea of what he did to lose weight and how he's been looking so slim lately (35:44). The guys also discuss Digs rollerblading to work and whether or not he'd be able to walk 2 miles. They also give The Machine, Bert Kreischer, a call to ask him if it was worth it running the LA Marathon, what it's like to possess the Mickey Mantle gene, and the ramifications of falling asleep in bed with a Snickers bar (43:01). Later, stick around for this week's wrestling recap as Rip Rogers, Robbie Fox, and Vibbs join Pat and Nick to discuss everything you may have missed in the WWE leading up to Wrestlemania (01:04:02). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 149 - We Did A Gameshow
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, and Digs discuss Pat's thoughts on watching Goodfellas for the first time over the weekend, and do a deep dive into some movie talk. They also chat about Dig's complete disdain for Sister Jean, and break down what to expect from Pat's new game show, which premiered last night. Pat also recounts the few times that he's seen ghosts, and the guys break down some of the stories that are making waves in the world right now. Today's show is a great time. Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 148 - Let's Have A Friday
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat and Shaun are joined by the Heartland Radio crew to wrap up the week and shoot the breeze a little bit. They discuss their favorite stories of the week including a brief recap of what it was like developing, planning, and shooting a game show, Vibbs' continued wrestling education, Joe Biden and Donald Trump's current feud, stealing cars while babies are laying in the backseat, and much more. As always, the guys select a couple of songs for Friday Bangerz to help send you into the weekend the right way. Today's show is a great time. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 147 - 2018 MLB MVP
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, Digs, and Zito chat about some movies as Pat dives a little deeper into some of the recent films that he's enjoyed, cover some of the news stories that are making waves around the world, and chat a little bit about Pat's big announcement with the WWE. Cincinnati Reds catcher, and 2017 Gold Glove winner, Tucker Barnhart, also joins the show to chat with the guys about how he's dealing with the dog days of spring training, he gives a small preview of the upcoming season, and plays, "are you a catcher or not?" with Digs (43:58). Later, sports handicapper and electric factory, Brandon Lang, joins the show to tell a few hilarious stories, including how to deal with breakups and some tips about marriage, and he gives everyone a couple of picks for the Sweet Sixteen (1:09:18). After the show, Pat and Nick are joined by wrestling legend Rip Rogers, Vibbs, and Barstool's own wrestling aficionado Robbie Fox to break down Pat signing a contract with the WWE, Daniel Bryan returning to in-ring competition, and wrap up the week in wrestling as we creep closer and closer to Wrestlemania in New Orleans (1:25:00). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 146 - AQ Shipley & Big Cat
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, and Digs are joined in studio by friend of Barstool Heartland, our resident little person, Colin (@whiskeynaps) as they talk about some of the gigs he's had including some films and music videos. The guys also discuss Pat's upcoming game show, as well as some other topical news including a recap of St. Patty's Day weekend, March Madness, and Vladimir Putin winning another election. Also calling into the show is the center for the Arizona Cardinals and good friend of the show, AQ Shipley, as he discusses what he's been doing in the offseason, how he feels about Sam Bradford being his new quarterback, and what he's done to prepare to become a father (11:00). Later, cohost of Pardon My Take (the #1 sports podcast on the planet), Big Cat, joins the guys in studio to talk about how he fared gambling during the first two rounds of the NCAA tournament, what its been like breaking news during the NFL offseason, and what he did for St. Patrick's Day (58:29). Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 145 - March Madness Mayhem
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat and Shaun are joined by the Heartland Radio crew as they chat about the start of March Madness, what the plans are for St. Patrick's Day, and discuss some of their favorite news stories of the week including a plane with over $300 million in gold crashing in Russia, a woman gouging her eyes out while high on meth, and Vibbs becoming the owner of a Little League Baseball team. As always, the guys send you into St. Patrick's Day weekend with some Friday Bangerz that will help set the mood for the holiday and March Madness. Come laugh with us. Cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 144 - Thank You To A Vet
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, and Digs are joined by coworker, veteran, and American badass @wizcauleyfa, Ryan Cauley, to chat about the project he is currently working on, and a little more background on his experiences while in Iraq serving for our country. The guys also chat about Digs almost dying after tying a cinder block to his ankle before walking on a frozen lake and Pat's brief but successful career playing hockey. Later, professional sports handicapper, and the source material for the gambling film "Two for the Money," Brandon Lang joins the show to give a couple of NCAA tournament picks, and breaks down what to do to close with a stripper (42:51). After the show, stick around for the wrestling recap where Rip Rogers, Nick, Pat, and Vibbs are joined by WWE superfan Robbie Fox to discuss everything you might have missed in the WWE and the Road to Wrestlemania (1:10:36). Come laugh with us, cheers.

episodes.title: PMS 143 - T's And P's To Taylor Swift
episodes.description: On today's show, Pat, Shaun, Nick, and Digs take some time to give Foxy some feedback on his shoes and whether or not Mr. Rogers would wear them, and chat about what Pat has under the hood of some of his vehicles.
